title: Print, "Flirting on the Sea-Shore and on the Meadow, from Harper's Weekly, September 19, 1874, p. 780", 1874
signed: Signed, upper half, lower left corner: W.H.
inscribed: Caption: FLIRTING ON THE SEA-SHORE AND ON THE MEADOW.-(DRAWN BY WINSLOW HOMER.)
creditline: Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.
description: Upper half:  Middle-aged couple on the sand in moonlight.  Man is propped on elbow facing woman.  Woman is seated with back to viewer.  Lower half:  Two barefoot boys lying in a meadow facing seated girl at high noon.  Family of ducks in the lower left.  Information from: Ferber, Linda S., Barbara Dayer Gallati and Marilyn S. Kushner, Winslow Homer: Illustrating America (New York: George Braziller in association with Brooklyn Museum of Art, 2000), p. 86.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Flirting on the Sea-Shore and on the Meadow, from Harper's Weekly, September 19, 1874, p. 780", 1874.
1874. Wood engraving on paper. Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.. 1947-4-32.
